Distance learning assignments are posted on the district website and will begin tomorrow, Monday, March 23. Schools will be open tomorrow for curbside pickup of packets for those who do not have internet access. All should remain in their cars, in line for this drive-thru pickup process.

Please use the assignments on the website if at all possible. If you or your student have any questions about the distance learning assignments, please email your teacher.

All CTE and academic dual credit courses will resume online tomorrow through the Canvas platform. Instructions are also posted on the district website. Again, please reach out to your CTE instructor or dual credit teacher if you have any questions or need any assistance.

Parents, we thank you for all you’re doing at home to help your children stay on track while out of school. We will get through this together!

February 28 at 12:46 PM ·

Our next PHS Spotlight is Mrs. Shelley McHenry. She teaches in the Math Department, and she currently handles Algebra II, Geometry, and Math Essentials. She is a 19-year PPSD veteran.

In her words...

"I started my teaching career over 19 years ago with the Pearl Public School system I have been teaching at PHS for the last 11 years and absolutely love it. The atmosphere here is second to none. Our administration and faculty are supportive not only on the job but outside the work place as well. I plan to teach here until I retire, because I can’t imagine being anywhere else. #wearefamily

My students are the reason that I love working at PHS. The smiles on their faces as the walk across the stage at graduation makes all the heartache and difficult days worth every minute."
